channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes on end section of Melville, 12th December
item.description:
Multiple sizable potholes on stretch between roundabout and cut through to Barnes Wallis.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 116 Melville Road, Churchdown

item.title: Large pothole on Melville Rd just before turning circle, 12th December
item.description:
Pothole is at least 3inches deep and approx 1ft long. Has been there for many months. Located just before turning circle roundabout with tree
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 129 Melville Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branch has been cut back but not far enough, 11th December
item.description:
This branch has been cut back, making it difficult to see in the dark when driving down the hill, it is on the nearside, the mirror of my coach caught the cut off branch and shattered the mirror casing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lilleybrook Golf Club, 313 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 18" dia pot hole, 9th December
item.description:
This pothole on the nearside when travelling towards Hucclecote Road has been there for 6 months or more and is gradually getting bigger and deeper. It's a man eater! Any cyclict who doesn't know it's there especially in poor light or an night risk a very serious accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 59 Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud on roas from building sites, 9th December
item.description:
The mud on the road from the building sites collected on the wheels of my bike and when I turned right into Brionne Way, the bike slipped from under me and I hit the deck. Ruined a pair of winter long bibs and grazed my right knee badly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 136 Innsworth Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights red in all directions. Lots of traffic., 9th December
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights are red for all direction causing a lot of traffic and delays.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes Stoke Road . Access from Stoke Orchard Road, 9th December
item.description:
These potholes are getting bigger, difficult to swerve to avoid them if cars are parked on the other side of the road,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Boddington

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): West Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Dangerous Parking on corners, 8th December
item.description:
Cars and Vans are parking on corners and sides of Seneca Way so it is very difficult and unsafe to drive to the ends of Linwell Close. Parked cars force you onto the wrong side of the road on blind corners due to bad parking choices and no double yellows.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 35 Seneca Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Quantity of Wooden Frames in Layby / Passing Place/ Field Gate, 8th December
item.description:
The location is on the road going towards Whittington and about100 yards past the turning to Picadilly Farm at the top of Aggs Hill - just before the Cotswaold Way and woods - on the right hand side. There is a lyby / passing Place / field gate in which the material has been dumped. Please can it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging branch, 8th December
item.description:
There is a large broken branch overhanging the pavement making walking dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Manor Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road overwhelmed with traffic, 7th December
item.description:
Robert Burns Avenue cannot cope with the volumes of traffic that it has to handle at school drop-off and pick-up times. We routinely see a queue of cars at these times, stationary, waiting to get through the mess. The result is a build up of fumes just at the times when our children are there in numbers. It amounts to a public health hazard as well as the risk to people from manoeuvring vehicles. Please consider closing the road to cars at these times and improving infrastructure for active travel.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 65 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12 inch potholes, 7th December
item.description:
There needs to be an inspection of GL51 6NU so that you can fill in NUMEROUS and large developing potholes that have appeared (RE-APPEARED) at the same time. Some are in the carriageway whereas others are on the speedbumps. The one I am reporting is approx 12inchs long by maybe 4inchs wide and looks deep and is midway between the first and second speedbump from the Bibury Rd junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 45 Orchard Way, Cheltenham
